pr_title: Server side field-level validations infrastructure (and usage on CLM)

timeline.author: cbbayburt
cbbayburt

replies.bodyText:
Note that putIfAbsent will return null if the key does not exist yet.
From Map docs:

If the specified key is not already associated with a value (or is mapped to null) associates it with the given value and returns null, else returns the current value.

Final solution is a mix of original implementation and you proposal:
fieldValidationErrors.putIfAbsent(field, new LinkedList());
fieldValidationErrors.get(field).add(error);

Thanks
replies.author: ricardoasmarques

replies.bodyText: Oh right, I overlooked that, good catch, thanks!
replies.author: cbbayburt

timeline.bodyText: You can also use: fieldValidationErrors.forEach((key, value) -> { ... }) here for simplicity

timeline.bodyText: IIUC getErrors().isEmpty() && getFieldErrors().isEmpty() is supposed to return the same check result of hasErrors(), then I'd reuse it instead.
timeline.author: ncounter

timeline.bodyText:
Just for the sake of the logic and computation, feel free to use any of the alternatives or drop them:
a. return (getErrors().size() + getFieldErrors().size()) > 0
b. return !getErrors().isEmpty() || !getFieldErrors().isEmpty()
